meanings.definition: Difficult to deal with or solve.
meanings.sent1: The math problem was very problematical for the students.
meanings.sent2: Finding a solution to the issue proved to be quite problematical.
meanings.sent3: It was quite problematical trying to fit all the luggage into the tiny car.
meanings.sent4: The problematical puzzle of life often leaves us searching for answers.
meanings.sent5: The dark and stormy night added a problematical twist to their journey.

meanings.sent1: The witness's testimony was problematical and raised doubts.
meanings.sent2: The results of the experiment were deemed problematical by the researchers.
meanings.sent3: It was rather problematical whether the cat would catch the elusive mouse.
meanings.sent4: The future of the project seemed problematical, causing concern among the team.
meanings.sent5: The mysterious stranger's intentions remained problematical to the townspeople.
